instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 12V dropping issue.
threads.message:
HI
Im working on a 2915 that had heavy liquid damaged, ive done a lot of rework, Ive got it to the point where it chimes and remains on in SMC bypass.

Now when its not in SMC bypass the system does spin the fans, but only when 12V is high, it often drops to about 3V then goes back to  12V. It seems like the SMC is turning the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> off for some reason. 
Ive already replaced the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, The SMC, check all current sensing around the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.ect and have had no symtom changes atall.

Any help would be appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 12V dropping issue.
threads.message: Must be an issue with current sense circuits. Check <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22/51/52 and traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 12V dropping issue.
threads.message: As stated above i have checked the ISL's current sensing. They are all correct. ive had a look at it under the micrsocope, all the traces are intact.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 12V dropping issue.
threads.message: also 12V often peaks at 13.2 witch is iffy at best.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 12V dropping issue.
threads.message: Could you measure resistance between pin 17/18 and between pin 27/28 and report values please???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 12V dropping issue.
threads.message:
Thanks duke, there was a tiny trace break on pin 17. Dont usualy miss things like that. 

Typically this board is still a pain in the ass. Its now posting but with a messed up screen, It boots though, im fairly sure the GMUX has failed. Just my luck.
